com.pipe42.data

Class Xml

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pipe42.data.Xml

  • public class Xml
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to manipulate the file/folder specific xml files
    Version:
    0.1a

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Xml() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getXmlTemplateNames()
      Reads all the file names of the xml files in the data/templates folder and returns an array of names minus the file extension ".xml".
      static void makeXmlFromFolderTree() 
      org.w3c.dom.Document readXml(java.lang.String path)
      Reads a xml file and returns a raw Document object
      static java.lang.Boolean writeFolderCheckFile(java.lang.String filePathAndName, java.lang.String projectName)
      Write a tiny .pipe42 file into the root of the project folder tree in order to know that this particular folder tree structure is a valid project and what project it belongs to.
      static void writeFolderTree(java.lang.String templateName, java.lang.String rootPath, java.lang.String projectName)
      Reads a template xml file from the data/templates folder templateName must be the file name WITHOUT the .xml extension NOTE: The parameter "name" in the tag in the template file MUST be the same as the file name (without file extension).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • readXml

        public org.w3c.dom.Document readXml(java.lang.String path)
        Reads a xml file and returns a raw Document object
        Parameters:
        path - path to xml file as relative String
        Returns:
        the raw Document object

      • writeFolderTree

        public static void writeFolderTree(java.lang.String templateName,
                                   java.lang.String rootPath,
                                   java.lang.String projectName)
        Reads a template xml file from the data/templates folder templateName must be the file name WITHOUT the .xml extension NOTE: The parameter "name" in the tag in the template file MUST be the same as the file name (without file extension).
        Parameters:
        templateName - the template file name as String without file extension

      • writeFolderCheckFile

        public static java.lang.Boolean writeFolderCheckFile(java.lang.String filePathAndName,
                                                     java.lang.String projectName)
        Write a tiny .pipe42 file into the root of the project folder tree in order to know that this particular folder tree structure is a valid project and what project it belongs to.
        Parameters:
        filePathAndName - path of type string to the root of the folder tree
        projectName - the project name of type String
        Returns:
        true if success, otherwise false

      • getXmlTemplateNames

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getXmlTemplateNames()
        Reads all the file names of the xml files in the data/templates folder and returns an array of names minus the file extension ".xml".
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of template names of type String

        public static void makeXmlFromFolderTree()
